content.description: Traverse the low, narrow shelf trending rightward and diagonally up to a short corner that leads past some more ledges. Follow obvious route to the top.

climbs.name: Hidden Blade
climbs.fa: Several people TR'd the route before I bolted it and led it.

content.description: Climb the bolted face to a small ledge below the flaring groove and traverse right onto a steep face with thin holds. climb up and right to an improbable layback. Follow up to a wide ledge. Continue up easy slab protected with a #2 BD cam or just run it out. The anchor has been taken and should be replaced soon.
content.protection: Mainly bolts. A #2 Camalot can be placed for the final easy boulder problem above  a ledge at the top. you could bring Gear to #4 camalot for the anchor.
content.location: Bolted line just left of the slabby wide crack.

content.description: This is a east southeast facing wall on the left side of the trail about 200 feet in. Walk through a squeeze in the rocks, over a rocky hump and down until you can easily enter a wash on the left. The Wall of Payne is the tall, steep wall on the left. The rock is on city property. The adjacent neighbor has been known to holler at people climbing. Please contact me on the Mountain Project email link if this happens.
